titleStmt.title: John Boyle to W. H. Sidell
CWG14178

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Assistant Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 1 ; 5 Sept 1863 - 2 Feb 1864

body.p:
251
Nov. 3.
Maj. W. H. Sidell U. S. A.
A. A. Pro. Mar. Genl.
Louisville -- Ky.
Maj.

Your communication concerning the paragraph in the Governor's Proclamation relating to the recruiting of Regiments was referred to his Excellency -- who has already answered it. He has informed you of the promises made by the Hon. Sec'y of War -- Stanton. Of course no need, or will occur between the various Departments, laboring for a common object.

Respectfully
Your obt Sservt
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen of Ky.
